alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 7:07PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cheyenne, northeastern Kimball, southwestern Morrill and southeastern Banner Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 607 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Redington, or 19 miles northeast of Kimball, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Redington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
